page.title: 01SECLUDED N. BUCKINGHAMSHIRE
page.content: Block contains four villages hidden in gently undulating country intersected by small N/S tributaries of the Great Ouse to the south which meanders in the valley W to E. The area is predominantly agricultural - one small dairy farm and five sizeable sheep flocks, wheat, barley, oats, oilseed rape and maize are grown on arable land. Woodland, mainly amenity. Small villages no longer provide labour for farms and traditional village shops almost extinct; cottages have been gentrified by upwardly mobile and new houses built as infilling. Stowe School (3) is the site of the seat of the Dukes of Buckingham - teaches 600+ boys and a few girls. Large need for labour. Magnificnet buildings and amenity parkland with 'follys' and classical temples. Soil types are mixed due to glacial deposits - heavy
